co2-calculation: Commercial production of 1 kg processed honey ranges between 0.6-0.9 kg CO2e/kg (1). Average is 0.75 kg CO2e/kg
other-references: Fluri et al., 2004. Bienenhaltung in der Schweiz. Zentrum für Bienenforschung. Agroscope Liebefeld-Poiseux.
references: 1. Kendall et al., 2010. Carbon Footprint of U . S . Honey Production and Packing Report to the National Honey Board. Page 15: commercial production of 1 kg processed honey ranges between 0.6-0.9 kg CO2e/kg
calculation-process-documentation:
kg of processed honey in the US excluding consumer-related stages, no packaging.  Case study of 2 large scale > 4000 colonies, 2 medium scale > 1500 colonies and 2 small scale farmers (3-5 colonies). Allocation between pollination service, honey and wax. Mainly through sub-process definition. 1.5% of honey is lost during processing. 

Different packaging included in study and could be separately extracted.
name: Honig
comments: The question "what kind of honey production is representative for Switzerland?" remains
